msbt.message: Can you imagine swimming against a river your whole life? You'd get, like, crazy MEGA built! I'm kinda jealous!
To swim like them, you need strong abs and lats and, uhlike a dozen other bits I don't know the names of.
I've been watching these fishies for a while, trying to pick up a few swimming tips, .Problem is, none of 'em paddle, so I think I'm out of luck.
You ever wonder what fish think about? I bet they only ever think about food, .Oh well! Wanna get some chow?
Carrying water buckets is a tough workoutand an aquarium is just a really big bucket I've got an idea!
Chilling by the fish tanks is the best thing after a hard workout. It's like a deep-tissue brain massage!
What kind of training do you think these fish do? Like, is it ALL swimming, or do they lift too?
These fish are living the celebrity life. I hope they haven't forgotten their fishy friends back home!
These fish are always swimming, so it's like they NEVER stop working out, even when they're asleep!
So whaddaya think of 's aquarium?Me? I think it's the perfect place to chill after a workout, .
So are you, like, going from island to island to check out the muscles on all the fish, ?
I'll tell you a secret. Sometimes I'll say I'm going out for a jog, but really, I come in here and take a nap.
The museum's fish tanks are just big swimming pools. I wonder if No, they'd throw me out, .
Our new museum's got some seriously cool fish tanks in it.It's basically an all-you-can-swim facility. For the fish, I mean.
There's a path in the museum that'd be PERFECT for wind sprintsbut I don't want Blathers to kick me out.Weighing incredible athleticism against good citizenship is tough sometimes, .
